subject: Web3
title: Vitalik Buterin's Vision
description: A fast breakdown of Vitalik Buterin's Vision for builders.

hook.text: In 2013, a 19-year-old college dropout proposed a blockchain that could run any program, not just money.

buildup.text: Vitalik Buterin was a Bitcoin writer who saw the blockchain's potential beyond currency.

discovery.text: He wrote a white paper describing Ethereum: a world computer anyone could program without permission.

twist.text: Established crypto developers told him it couldn't work. He raised $18 million in a crowdsale and built it anyway.

climax.text: Ethereum launched in 2015 and became the foundation of DeFi, NFTs, and thousands of decentralized apps.

punchline.text: A teenager's white paper became the world's second-largest blockchain.

quiz.question: How old was Vitalik Buterin when he proposed Ethereum?
